```{=html}
<div class="container">
  <div class="full-bleed bg-black text-white">
    <div class="phd-grid phd-grid--static no-expand" role="list">
      <section class="phd-item static-item" role="listitem">
        <div class="static-text">
          <h4 class="font-rock">ART</h4>
          <br>
          <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">On the left handside (or as the first row when viewed on a small screen), you will find artistic and abstract representations that reflect the inferences or interpretations made from the data.</p>
            <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">If you click on the artwork, it will expand to reveal the full piece, and you will find a hyperlink labelled "Behind the curtain" that leads to a Wikimedia Commons page describing the meaning behind the piece.</p>
            <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">To return to the other representations of the analyses, please click on the expanded artwork.</p>
        </div>
      </section>
  
      <section class="phd-item static-item" role="listitem">
        <div class="static-text">
          <h4><span style="font-family: 'Brush Script MT', cursive;">POETRY</span></h4>
          <br>
          <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">In the middle (or on the second row when viewed on a small screen), you will find a poetic interpretation that reflects the inferences or patterns emerging from the data.</p> 
            <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">If you click on the word, it will expand to reveal the poem, and you will find a hyperlink labelled "More words about the matter" that leads to the publication of the research or a traditional reporting of the analyses.</p>
            <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">To return to the other representations of the analyses, please click on the poem.</p>
        </div>
      </section>
  
      <section class="phd-item static-item" role="listitem">
        <div class="static-text">
          <h4><span style="font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace;">
      DATA VISUALISATION</span></h4>
          <br>
          <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">On the right handside (or as the last row when viewed on a small screen), you will find visualisations that represent patterns in the data.</p>
            <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">If you click on the graph or chart, it will expand to reveal the full chart or sequence of charts. You will also find a hyperlink labelled "Open seasame" that leads to the Open Science Framework (OSF) repository containing metadata and code from the analyses.</p>
            <br>
            <p class = "nav-page">To return to the other representations of the analyses, please click the white space outside the chart.</p>
        </div>
      </section>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
  
```
